discussion.author: carstenbauer
discussion.text: [noblock] Why is this called PYTHIA**8**.jl, that is, why is the version number included in the package name? If a version 9 of the upstream package is released, should we expect a PYTHIA9.jl? That doesn't seem ideal. Otherwise I think this can be merged.

discussion.author: Moelf
discussion.text:
[noblock] very good question, for some reason HEP has settled to this pattern:

- https://launchpad.net/mg5amcnlo
- https://github.com/scikit-hep/uproot5
- https://gitlab.cern.ch/hepmc/HepMC3
- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geant4

discussion.author: peremato
discussion.text: [noblock] PYTHIA6 was written in FORTRAN, PYTHIA8 is in C++. If ever there is a PYTHIA9 will be written on a different language, perhaps in Julia ðŸ˜„, so we do not expect a PYTHIA9 in the immediate future.

discussion.author: carstenbauer
discussion.text: Alright, I take it that these different "versions" are more like entire rewrites, in which case this makes sense. I'll go ahead and merge this.
